title: 'No credible evidence': SC acquits man on death row for girl's rape-murder
description: The Supreme Court overturned the death sentence of a man convicted of rape and murder, stating the police made him a scapegoat. The court found the prosecution failed to prove the case beyond a reasonable doubt, highlighting a lack of credible evidence and questioning the authenticity of CCTV footage.

title: BCCI using 'Team India' name: Delhi HC dismisses PIL; calls it 'sheer wastage of time’
description: The Delhi High Court dismissed a PIL questioning the BCCI's right to call its players the 'Indian cricket team'. Judges deemed the plea a 'sheer wastage' of judicial time, emphasising that the team unequivocally represents India in international sports, regardless of the BCCI's private status. The court found no violation of emblem or flag laws.

title: India’s invasive aliens problem complicates wait to understand scope
description: Conservation researchers, practitioners, and policymakers in India face a dilemma. As one scientist put it: should they wait to document the effects of all these species to prepare a conservation plan or should they document and conserve in parallel?

title: India's ODI captain: 'Stop the memes' - Mohd Shami on Gill replacing Rohit
description: Veteran pacer Mohammed Shami has backed Shubman Gill's ODI captaincy, urging fans to cease online criticism and memes. Shami emphasized that the decision by the BCCI and selectors is strategic, citing Gill's prior captaincy experience. He reminded supporters that leadership changes are natural in cricket and urged them to support the new captain as he embarks on this new chapter.

She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: ‘No idea’: Trump says might not win Nobel peace prize despite ending 'many' wars
description: Donald Trump is unsure about winning the Nobel Peace Prize. He stated his administration resolved seven wars and is close to settling an eighth. Trump believes he deserves the award for his peace efforts. The Nobel Peace Prize announcement is scheduled for Friday. Trump was previously nominated but did not win.

description: The Bombay High Court found prima facie illegality in DRI officer’s move to recall goods already cleared by Customs

title: Supreme Court nixes govt's plea for norms to make sentences victim-centric
description: The Supreme Court rejected the government's plea for victim-centric sentencing guidelines, particularly for death penalty cases. The Centre had sought to prioritise victims and society over accused-centric considerations and introduce strict timelines for appeals and mercy petitions. The court found the plea without merit, upholding existing judicial precedents.

title: Rakesh Kishore, a septuagenarian lawyer who is ‘unknown’ in legal circle and ‘invisible’ in society
description: He praises the Yogi government’s ‘bulldozer action’ against Muslims in Bareilly, calling it ‘the only way to deliver justice in present times’

title: Coldrif row: MP took 2 weeks to raise red flag on cough syrup deaths
description: Children's deaths in MP due to renal failure were initially reported in September, with authorities taking action after Nagpur hospitals alerted them. Biopsy reports confirmed acute tubular injury, leading to the identification of substandard cough syrups, including Coldrif, containing toxic diethylene glycol, prompting a state-wide ban.

title: Ladakh unrest: Leh Bar seeks Rs 1 cr each for firing victims; demands judicial probe
description: The Leh Bar Association has demanded Rs 1 crore compensation for each family of the four killed in the September 24 firing and an impartial judicial inquiry headed by a retired Supreme Court judge.

title: J&K: Army launches massive search operation to trace 2 missing soldiers
description: Two soldiers have gone missing in a forested area of south Kashmir's Anantnag district after encountering a severe snowstorm. An intense search and rescue operation, supported by choppers, is underway but hampered by adverse weather conditions. Officials believe the soldiers may be unable to communicate due to the inclement weather.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: Death toll mounts to 21; CM Yadav admits lapses
description: Tragedy strikes as cough syrup deaths climb to 21 across Madhya Pradesh, with new fatalities in Betul and Pandhurna. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav admitted to systemic lapses, vowing to improve coordination. The poisonous diethylene glycol in Coldrif syrup is blamed for renal failure. Meanwhile, a one-year-old boy recovered, offering a glimmer of hope amidst the ongoing investigation into the manufacturer.

title: J&K: Omar govt failed to protect land & dignity of people, alleges Mehbooba
description: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti has slammed Chief Minister Omar Abdullah for inaction on land lease rules, risking eviction for hotels and institutions. She announced her party's 'Anti-bulldozer Bill' to regularize land holdings of those in possession for over 30 years. Meanwhile, BJP leader Sunil Sharma questioned the CM's focus on statehood.

title: France's outgoing Prime Minister expects Macron to name his replacement in 48 hours
description: Sébastien Lecornu resigned abruptly on Monday just 14 hours after naming his Cabinet

title: IndiGo to launch Del-Manchester service; Mum-Manchester flights set to increase
description: IndiGo is launching daily flights between New Delhi and Manchester, adding to its existing Mumbai route. This expansion, announced during a UK trade mission, will result in nine direct flights weekly between Manchester and India. The new services are projected to boost exports, tourism, and job creation.

‘Very close’: Trump says 'good chance' for Gaza deal; may visit Middle East this week
description: President Trump announced a Gaza peace deal with Hamas is 'very close,' potentially traveling to the Middle East Sunday.  Negotiations, involving Egypt, Qatar, and Turkey, are based on a 20-point proposal for a ceasefire and Hamas disarmament.  However, Hamas demands a full Israeli withdrawal and permanent ceasefire, seeking assurances against renewed military action.

description: Samba district police apprehended Manjit Singh, a Sikh man, for allegedly desecrating the Guru Granth Sahib at a local gurdwara. The incident, involving the setting ablaze of the holy text with inflammable oil, has ignited widespread protests from the Sikh community. Authorities have registered an FIR and are urging cooperation to quell rumors.

title: Stephen Curry injury update: Will Warriors star play vs Trail Blazers tonight?
description: Stephen Curry is set to play tonight against the Portland Trail Blazers, confirmed by coach Steve Kerr. After a strong preseason opener, Curry, fully recovered from a hamstring injury, will see his minutes gradually increase. His participation signals the Warriors' focus on building veteran chemistry and rhythm for the upcoming 2025-26 NBA season.

title: Cardi B breaks silence amid Stefon Diggs’ new lawsuit from ex Mulan Hernandez
description: Amidst a paternity dispute and sexual assault allegations, NFL star Stefon Diggs faces a lawsuit from ex-girlfriend Mulan Hernandez, who claims he assaulted her and pressured her to sign an NDA. Diggs had previously accused Hernandez and a friend of extortion and assault. Cardi B, Diggs' pregnant partner, posted a cryptic "Am I the Drama?" message.

description: IAF chief Air Chief Marshal A P Singh highlighted the "bold and precise" attacks during Operation Sindoor as a demonstration of air power's effectiveness in shaping military outcomes. The deep precision strikes, conducted from May 7 to 10, restored offensive air action's importance and showcased the force's ability to strike deep inside enemy territory with precision.

title: J&K: Security forces conduct search ops in Rajouri, Udhampur to track terrorists
description: Security forces launched extensive search operations in Rajouri and Udhampur districts of Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday following a brief firefight with terrorists in Rajouri's Kandi area. Troops are combing remote, forested regions and checking vehicles to track down the militants. A separate operation is underway in Udhampur after locals reported suspicious movements.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury update: Rehab progress hints at early Cowboys comeback

Having missed two games, Lamb was seen doing rehab work, marking a significant step.  Owner Stephen Jones indicated Lamb is among several players who could return within two weeks, potentially bolstering the team's playoff hopes.

Infinity walk: How figure-8 walking boosts brain function and balance
description: A simple walking technique, the Infinity Walk, is gaining attention for its profound impact on the brain and nervous system. This figure-8 pattern walk synchronizes brain hemispheres, sharpens focus, and improves balance. It also engages core muscles, aiding posture. Studies suggest it can calm the nervous system and reduce stress.

His death has shocked the boxing world. Gatti Jr. was training to follow his father's boxing career. This tragedy occurs nearly 16 years after his father's mysterious death in Brazil.

description: Police said that a playschool is run on the ground floor of the building, whereas a real estate office is located on the first floor.

title: Work to convert overhead power lines into underground cables around temple nears completion
description: Officials of Tangedco, which executes the work, say that it has been a traditional practice to enforce regular power cuts to houses on key stretches around the temple during festival season to prevent any untoward incidents like electrocution of pilgrims during their visit to the temple.

Women's WC: AUS humiliate PAK; Mooney's century help Aussies top standings
description: Beth Mooney's spectacular 109, aided by Alana King's 51, rescued Australia from 76/7 to 221/9 against Pakistan.  The bowlers then delivered a dominant performance, with Kim Garth taking three wickets, to bowl out Pakistan for 114, securing a commanding 107-run victory. This win keeps Australia unbeaten, while Pakistan faced a third consecutive loss.

description: Twenty-one US lawmakers urged President Trump to reset ties with India, warning his punitive tariffs are harming both nations and pushing New Delhi towards rivals like China and Russia. The letter highlighted the strategic importance of India in the Indo-Pacific and the economic damage caused by the tariffs to American consumers and businesses.

The BJP and JD(U) are reportedly set to contest fewer seats than in 2020 to accommodate these requests. The alliance is working towards finalizing strategies and candidates ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

Freeman's generosity aims to usher in a new era of excellence and competitiveness for the Cardinal program.

description: IMF chief Kristalina Georgieva hailed India as a “key growth engine” of the global economy. She also said that the global economy is faring better than feared, but warned resilience may not last amid Trump-era tariffs, rising debt, and global uncertainty. Despite US-imposed tariffs, India recorded 7.8% GDP growth in Q1 FY 2025–26, driven by consumption and investment.

This strategic move, mirroring past rare earth tactics, aims to pressure President Trump ahead of the APEC summit. Farmers face a double blow of rising costs and a vanishing market, with potential for significant economic fallout in rural America.

Jitan Ram Manjhi invokes poetry for fair seat-sharing in NDA, while Left allies in Mahagathbandhan reject 'insulting' proposals. The absence of a clear chief ministerial face and leadership confusion are key issues.

title: ‘3 prizes in 2 years’: CEO Pichai celebrates Googlers winning Nobel Prize; says ‘Feeling lucky’
description: Google's Sundar Pichai celebrated Michel Devoret, John Martinis, and John Clarke's 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics. This marks Google's fifth Nobel laureate in two years, with Devoret leading hardware at Quantum AI and Martinis a former hardware team leader. Their foundational 1980s quantum mechanics research is credited with enabling future error-corrected quantum computers.

title: New proxy war? Pak's ISI forges LeT-ISKP alliance; what it means for India's security
description: Lashkar-e-Taiba and ISKP have reportedly formed a covert alliance in Balochistan. This partnership is allegedly engineered and funded by Pakistan's ISI. The groups aim to target Baloch people. There is a possibility of expansion to Jammu and Kashmir. Visual evidence shows commanders training together. This alliance follows India's counterterror actions.

title: Tech regulation: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to Google, Apple; ‘Follow Indian law’
description: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu outlined his company's three-tiered approach to user privacy on X. He detailed protections for "secret lover" data, a pledge against using customer data for advertising, and the limits of corporate responsibility in "secret rebel" cases, emphasizing adherence to national laws.

title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos: I always advise to young people - 'Go work at ...'
description: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos advises young aspiring entrepreneurs to gain foundational experience by working at McDonald's. He emphasizes that such roles teach crucial skills like responsibility, discipline, and customer interaction, which are vital for long-term success and often overlooked by Gen Z in their pursuit of rapid startup growth.
